title: Liam Neeson returns to THE bench as Love Actually sequel starts filming | Metro News
text:
Search Metro Follow us Love Actually sequel for Red Nose Day has already started filming and it’s giving us all the feels Jessica Walford for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 5:41 pm Look, it’s Daniel and Sam (Picture: WENN.com) 
Filming for the Love Actually sequel that will be aired on Red Nose Day has already started – and it’s giving us all the feels. 
Liam Neeson, who played Daniel in the 2003 romcom, and his onscreen son, Sam, played by Thomas Brodie-Sangster were spotted filming on *that bench* in London. 
Daniel in the film was tragically widowed when his wife, and Sam’s mum, died. 
When Sam became a recluse, Daniel confided in friends that he feared for his son. Liam Neeson and Thomas Brodie-Sangster (aka Daniel and Same) were spotted filming in London (Picture: WENN.com) The filming took place on the same bench from the 2003 romcom (Picture: Photo by Peter Mountain/Universal/Dna/REX/Shutterstock) THE FEELS (Picture: WENN.com) And what happened to Daniel and Claudia Schiffer? (Picture: WENN.com) 
But Sam revealed *on that bench* that the problem was he was in love – but she didn’t even know he existed. 
Cue attention-seeking drum playing, which *spoiler alert* led to Joanna (his crush) noticing him at the school Christmas concert. 
And Joanna (aka Sam’s love interest with that *amazing* voice) was also spotted on-set – which hopefully means that the Transatlantic love story kept going. 
It’s only been a few days since writer and director Richard Curtis broke the amazing news that the smash-hit would return for a reunion on Red Nose Day , in a special called Red Nose Day Actually. 
He said: ‘Over the years I’ve enjoyed doing Red Nose Day specials on TV things I’ve worked on – Blackadder, The Vicar of Dibley, and Mr Bean. Olivia Olsen, who played Joanna aged 11, was also spotted on set (Picture: WENN.com) Will their Transatlantic love blossom? (Picture: WENN.com) 
‘It seemed like a fun idea this year to do a special sketch based on one of my films, since Red Nose Day is now both in the UK and America. 
‘I would never have dreamt of writing a sequel to Love Actually, but I thought it might be fun to do ten minutes to see what everyone is now up to.’
